abstract: Li Lu, a Chinese hedge-fund manager who was once a student leader of the Tiananmen Square protests, is considered to be a top candidate to become a successor to Warren E. Buffett at Berkshire Hathaway, The Wall Street Journal reported.
snippet: Li Lu, a Chinese hedge-fund manager who was once a student leader of the Tiananmen Square protests, is considered to be a top candidate to become a successor to Warren E. Buffett at Berkshire Hathaway, The Wall Street Journal reported.
lead_paragraph: Warren E. Buffett has no immediate plans to retire. Yet the 80-year-old investor is believed to be grooming several possible successors at Berkshire Hathaway, The Wall Street Journal reported.

headline.main: Buffett Succession Watch: Meet Mr. Li
